title: The Kiss
description: "The Kiss" (Der Kuss) by Klimt is an oil painting on canvas created in 1908. It depicts a couple kissing, surrounded by a lush backdrop and ornamental patterns. The painting is considered one of Klimt's most significant works and is recognized for its innovative use of color, form, and patterns to create a sensual and erotic image. It's often seen as a representation of love and passion. It was painted during his Art Nouveau period, during which he developed an original style that blends elements of Byzantine art, traditional Viennese motifs, and Japanese influences. Klimt's "The Kiss" is frequently regarded as a symbol of women's emancipation and sexual liberation.
